summary: the main aim of the current research was to determine the efficacy and effect of the elapsed incubation time of treating the Vero cells infected with HSV-1 by G. glabra. the effect of cells pretreatment with licorice root extract, preincubation of virus with licorice root extract, and antiviral activity were assessed. licorice root is one of the oldest and most commonly prescribed traditional medicine, which has been used in the treatment of several diseases (4). in china, licorice (Gan Cao) has been reported as one of the oldest and most commonly prescribed traditional medicine. a nucleoside analog and an antiherpetic drug has partially fulfilled the need for treating the infection entirely. however, it leads to viral resistance and consequently, viral latency and recurrence (6). the main goal of the current study was in vitro evaluation of possible antiherpetic and virucidal activity of G. glabra.
